corpus.description: Texts from Nuclear Threat Initiative website, created by Center for Non-Proliferation Studies
corpus.name: NTI

sentence.text: At the outset of the move to Weldon , house prices in the area were very depressed and people from the South East could trade up favourably .
At the outset of the plans , we had prayed for a sign of divine approval .
At the outset of the planning process , the forecasts which are taken into account may have been subjected to bias .
At the outset of our friendship it was always Brian who exploded and damn the consequences .
At the outset of Lunch-time Opening , it is fair to say that customer reaction was quite slow but has increased quite significantly in the intervening months .
We had scaldini -- large , flat , iron containers which were filled with hot water at the outset of each journey -- to put our feet on .
Many of those anomalies were identified by my colleagues at the very outset of the poll tax escapade .
At the outset of World War Two , with Hungary still a neutral country , Peto travelled to London on business .
There was a whole platoon of black-and-whites on our tail at the outset , but we lost them one by one .
At the outset I suggested that there has been considerable grass-roots enthusiasm to initiate profiling schemes .
It is better to take this decision at the outset rather than have a poorly planned attempt backfire on the parents .
There had been 75 Holderness-Manolo personnel at the outset of this engagement .
At the outset two points should be made clear .
It was official policy at the outset to broadcast as far as possible in African languages .
From the outset the whole team here at the hospital was instinctively pally and collegial .
From the outset of a transformational-change effort , information must flow freely between and among the different parts of the organization .
The whole system was ill-conceived from the outset .
It is obvious from the outset that some ferrets are more capable workers than others .
King Hussein of Jordan was from the outset , much as during the Iran -Iraq war , a supporter of Iraq .
Iconoclasm was from the outset inspired by the government .
At the outset it may prove useful , if only to discover differences rather than similarities , to contrast Great-Russian nationalism with French .
I was fairly ignorant of Third World literature at the outset and in many respects still am .
The project had been wrong-footed from the outset .
The imposition of VAT misdeclaration and serious default surcharges was something the federation had opposed since its outset .
From its outset , Operation Barbarossa assumed a class character , and it quickly escalated into a ` war of hatred " .
discount rate and acceptance commission known at outset to give certainty of costs .

Although ostensibly created entirely for defensive purposes , since government and Cuban military forces in Angola were reportedly equipped for and planning to use -- if not already using -- CW agents against the South African Defence Force ( SADF ) , from the outset the program also had offensive features and capabilities .
